column4: certain web pages won't load properly when i use firefox/chrome/whatever inside of ubuntu. the websites that won't work *will* work under windows on the same PC. anybody know what I'm missing?

certain web pages won't load properly when i use firefox/chrome/whatever inside of ubuntu. the websites that won't work *will* work under windows on the same PC. Do I need to call my ISP, or is this ubuntu doing something odd?
its probably not your ISP.
have you heard of this problem before?
what is the error on the websites?  How are they not displaying correctly?  Do you have any Ad blocking software installed?  That could be your problem.
i'll check the error. I think its connection timed out
and this is with gmail/yahoo and a couple other major players, so it shouldn't be them
it loads a really long URL and displays a white page. No specific error

that DOES sound like an ISP problem but if it works on Windows (same machine) then its most6 likely a software problem.  Have you tried installing any other browsers in Ubuntu (Opera, Aurora)?  Are you working from a fresh install of Ubuntu or did you just upgrade?
this is a fresh install of ubuntu. Only tweaks so far have been visual stuff. I've tried chrome and firefox with similar results
is it possible for you to take a screenshot of one of the pages that are screwing up?
sure, one sec
it looks like this may in fact be an ISP issue. tinypic doesn't seem to want to let me upload.
are you running a firewall?
it should all be disabled. Packet filters are turned off. whatever settings my router has now work just fine in windows.
isn't that a windows thing?
isnt what a windows thing?  You lost me, man.
i was talking about the lack of a default login/pass
nope.  Most linux distros Ive used arew either "root" "toor" or nothing at all.
well then I guess i'm a n00b
me too?
